type.name: Drama
type.definition: A planned, creative, rendition of discourse involving two or more participants.
type.comments: Usually a drama involves mimesis of events, either real or imagined.

type.name: Formulaic Discourse
type.definition: A ritually or conventionally structured discourse.

type.name: Interactive Discourse
type.definition: Linguistic communication between two or more participants.

type.name: Language Play
type.definition: A language whose primary function is to be part of play, or a style of speech that involves a creative manipulation of the structures of the language.

type.name: Oratory
type.definition: Public speaking, or speaking eloquently according to rules or conventions.

type.name: Narrative
type.definition: A monologic discourse which represents temporally organized events.

type.name: Procedural Discourse
type.definition: An explanation or description of a method, process, or situation having ordered steps.

type.name: Report
type.definition: A factual account of some event or circumstance.

type.name: Singing
type.definition: Words or sounds articulated in succession with musical inflections or modulations of the voice.

type.name: Instrumental Music
type.definition: Music intended to be performed by a musical instrument or group of instruments.

type.name: Unintelligible Speech
type.definition: Utterances that are not intended to be interpretable as ordinary language.
